document_data.name: Chwinga
document_data.Description: Chwingas stood {{SIrange|0.5|1.0|ft|c}} tall, resembling small animated dolls with [[mask (object)|masks]] for faces. No chwinga masks were alike, and they often took the form of animal faces. Their hair was wild and unkempt while their limbs were slender and lean. The presence of chwingas was foreshadowed by mild natural phenomena, such as the presence of harmless insects or pleasant flowery scents. Further indication could be found in cool breezes, and a lusher surrounding scenery.
document_data.Personality: Incredibly shy in most aspects of their lives, chwingas were naturally curious and fascinated by humanoids, whose signs of civilization were alien to chwingas. Beings that wore armor, carried weapons, cooked food, and used tools were of great interest to them. Those that piqued a chwinga's interest enough could find themselves tailed by the diminutive elementals and given minor magical boons. The features that drew chwinga to individuals seemed completely arbitrary, ranging from height and hairstyle to artistic talent or other strange abilities.
document_data.Abilities:
Chwingas had inherent [[spellcasting]] abilities, along with the power to bestow various supernatural aids on those who caught their curiosity and compassion. They possessed the ability to take shelter and hide inside their natural surroundings, like in rocks or trees, becoming totally impervious to danger. They were agile and hard to pin down, primarily due to their hiding skills. 

While they adapted well to new natural environments, they could be driven mad by extreme weather conditions such as blizzards. It was said by some that they had the power to potentially change the climate of a given region of [[Faer√ªn]].
document_data.Society:
[[File:Chwingas.jpg|thumb|right|350px|Chwingas were quite playful and often a bit mischievous]]
Chwingas lived and slept within natural objects like rivers and trees. They were incapable of speech and didn't have names.

They considered themselves the modest caretakers of the natural world.
document_data.Biology:
Like most elementals, chwingas did not eat, drink, or breathe, but unusually they did sleep. Dead chwingas became petals, pollen, a puddle, or a stone.

Groups of chwingas have been been observed forming symbiotic relationships with long-living creatures, such as [[dragon tortoise]]s.
document_data.Habitat:
As they were spirits of nature, chwingas could be found in a wide range of biomes, from the warm, tropical climate of [[Chult]], to the frigid snow-covered lands of [[Icewind Dale]], and even the desert of [[Anauroch]].

Some chwingas were even observed to dwell within the reaches of [[wildspace]]. They made their homes on the surfaces of life-supporting moons and other celestial bodies, at times finding conveyance aboard passing [[spelljammer]]s or [[space guppy|space guppies]].
document_data.History:
[[File:Desertchwinga.jpg|thumb|right|350px|Chwingas from the desert of [[Anauroch]]]]
When a great number of emigrants from Chult migrated to the [[Ten Towns]] of [[Icewind Dale]], they brought with them a large number of chwinga spirits.

In the {{YearlinkName|1489}}, the young [[Dannika Graysteel]] sought to catch a chwinga in order to end the [[Everlasting Rime]] that had been plaguing Icewind Dale for years.
